content.text: In the figure below, ACDE is a parallelogram. $\angle AEB = 36^\circ$ and $\angle CBE = 157^\circ$. Find $\angle BCD$. [Diagram: A geometric figure is shown. It depicts a parallelogram ACDE. A line segment BE is drawn from vertex B to vertex E, forming a triangle ABE. Another line segment AB is drawn. The angle $\angle AEB$ is marked as $36^\circ$. The angle $\angle CBE$ is marked as $157^\circ$. The vertices are labeled A, B, C, D, E.]
content.text_latex: In the figure below, ACDE is a parallelogram. $\angle AEB = 36^\circ$ and $\angle CBE = 157^\circ$. Find $\angle BCD$.

diagrams.alt_text: A geometric figure showing a quadrilateral ACDE, which is stated to be a parallelogram. A diagonal BE is drawn from vertex B to vertex E. Another line segment AB is drawn. The vertices are labeled A, B, C, D, E. Angle $\angle AEB$ is marked as $36^\circ$. Angle $\angle CBE$ is marked as $157^\circ$.
